result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Patrick Doody Jr.

defendant.name: Doody, Michael Patrick, Jr.
defendant.address: 555 N Main Street Apt. 104, River Falls, WI 54022

records.addlTxt:
Includes 22CF703 and 22CF711

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing [or/and] random ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:13 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Michael Patrick Doody Jr. in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi with Intern Lanie Krause in court for Michael Patrick Doody Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF703 and 22CF711.  Court reviews file and notes bond review requested by Atty Dolfi.  Bond argument.  Court modifies bond. Adjourned at 1:17 PM. bph

10:30 AM - Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court w/defendant Michael Patrick Doody Jr. in court, in custody. INCLUDES: 22CF703 and 22CF711. 22CF703 - Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.   22CF711 - Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Bond continues in form and amount. Atty Dolfi would like to argue bond. Atty Ellenwood is not able to argue bond due to filling in for Atty Smestad. Court will set a BBH.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Settlement conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:30 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy   Defendant Michael Patrick Doody Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Michael Patrick Doody Jr.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin.   INCLUDES: 22CF703 (PH) & 22CF711 (PH).  
   
22CF703:  State calls Hudson PD Officer Elias Schendel.  Witness sworn.  State direct. Witness identifies DE.  Atty Dolfi cross.  Witness excused.  Argument by the State. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. 

22CF711: State calls SCCO Deputy Ashley VanDenmark.  Witness sworn.  State direct.  Witness identifies DE.  Atty Dolfi cross.  Redirect.  Witness excused.  State argument. Atty Dolfi argument.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Bonds continue.  Adjourned: 3:47
Arraignment scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
